title: Sousa Brasão (Manuel de)
body: He was born in the parish of S. Vicente on April 21, 1884, and passed away at his residence in the fortress of S. Lourenço on December 21, 1923. He was a captain of the Military Administration and served in southern Angola from 1914 to 1915, and in Mozambique from 1916 to 1917. He was elected as a deputy for Madeira on July 10, 1921, and collaborated in several newspapers of a partisan nature.

1884: Birth of Manuel de Sousa Brasão
1923: Death at the fortress of S. Lourenço
